sub_topic: Finding the chromatic index of a graph.
message_1:
Consider the following graph with 6 vertices: 

```
   1 --- 2
   |\   /|
   | \ / |
   |  3  |
   | / \ |
   |/   \|
   4 --- 5
```

What is the chromatic index of this graph?
message_2:
The chromatic index of a graph is the smallest number of colors needed to color its edges such that no two adjacent edges share the same color.

In the given graph, we can color the edges as follows:

```
   1 --- 2 (color 1)
   |\   /|
   | \ / |
(color 2) 3 (color 3)
   | / \ |
   |/   \|
   4 --- 5 (color 1)
```

Now, we can see that no two adjacent edges share the same color. Therefore, the chromatic index of this graph is 3.
